title: HQ ORB / new home shivers
description: A shivers afterthought appears after you've clicked through the other orbs available inside the shack. It's a discussion of how it feels to have a new centre of operations, a free home

dialogueTree.title: Shivers: "A brisk coastal wind still howls ag..."
dialogueTree.text: A brisk coastal wind still howls against the window of the shack. Occasionally the waves crawl in under the foundation, producing a low hum...

links.title: You: "Listen."
links.text: Listen.

links.title: Shivers: "The room feels muffled, like you pu..."
links.text: The room feels muffled, like you pulled your hat over your ears. Outside, it is cold and windy, but you're inside, and it feels safe and warm.

links.title: Shivers: "WHAT IS THIS PLACE TO YOU?"
links.text: WHAT IS THIS PLACE TO YOU?

links.title: You: "My new hangout, where I could silen..."
links.text: My new hangout, where I could silently sit, drink and die while looking at the waves roll in.

links.title: Shivers: "Behind the half-built cinder block..."
links.text: Behind the half-built cinder block house at the other end of the village there are three people, drinking. Your *new crew*. You don't need the old crew, oh no, you have a new crew to get drunk with.

links.title: Shivers: "You already were a part of their cr..."
links.text: You already were a part of their crew once. You can get drunk with them again. You're probably going to hang out there a lot, behind that cinder block house. It's where you belong.

links.title: You: ""This feels like a cozy hideout.""
links.text: "This feels like a cozy hideout."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm..." The lieutenant looks aroun..."
links.text: "Mhm..." The lieutenant looks around.

links.title: You: ""This feels like a cozy hideout.""
links.text: "This feels like a cozy hideout."

links.title: Shivers: "Who are you talking to? There is no..."
links.text: Who are you talking to? There is no one here. Not even cold.

links.title: You: "Thank you, strange sensation, for a..."
links.text: Thank you, strange sensation, for a fair assessment of the current situation.

links.title: Shivers: "Outside, the howl of the wind has p..."
links.text: Outside, the howl of the wind has picked up. The waves crash against the stilts again. It's as if you think the thought, but in someone else's voice...

links.title: Shivers: "REVACHOL FOREVER"
links.text: REVACHOL FOREVER

links.title: Shivers: "LOOK UNDER THE FLOORBOARDS"
links.text: LOOK UNDER THE FLOORBOARDS

links.title: You: "No, wait, I changed my mind, I want..."
links.text: No, wait, I changed my mind, I want to choose again.

links.title: Shivers: "There is no going back."
links.text: There is no going back.

links.title: You: "My forward base for the coastal par..."
links.text: My forward base for the coastal part of the operation.

links.title: Shivers: "Overhead you hear the forlorn shrie..."
links.text: Overhead you hear the forlorn shriek of seagulls. Far below the birds -- a wooden boardwalk, filled with abandoned stands, tables and benches, echoes from a long lost time.

links.title: Shivers: "A middle-aged man stands in a run-d..."
links.text: A middle-aged man stands in a run-down shack on the edge of a fishing village, listening to the heater hum on the wall.

links.title: You: "It's free. That's good enough. I co..."
links.text: It's free. That's good enough. I could live here.

links.title: Shivers: "Waves crash unto the beach, drownin..."
links.text: Waves crash unto the beach, drowning the reeds. Far to the south a congregation gathers to a soup kitchen in a shelter for the homeless. An old woman gives out knitted scarves for free.

links.title: Shivers: "This could have been you. This coul..."
links.text: This could have been you. This could still be you. A down-on-his-luck nobody, trying to survive.

links.title: You: "A possible resting spot for my fugi..."
links.text: A possible resting spot for my fugitive is what it is.

links.title: Shivers: "Waves crash unto the beach, drownin..."
links.text: Waves crash unto the beach, drowning the reeds. Far to the south a congregation gathers to a soup kitchen in a shelter for the homeless. An old woman gives out knitted scarves for free.

links.title: Shivers: "Far to the southeast, two men and a..."
links.text: Far to the southeast, two men and a woman dress themselves in ceramic armour. A shortwave radio hisses on the windowsill. One makes a salute. The other downs a drink. Weapons under the bed...

links.title: Shivers: "A middle-aged man stands in a run-d..."
links.text: A middle-aged man stands in a run-down shack on the edge of a fishing village. Nothing nods, no one salutes him. No sight of the fugitive.

links.title: You: "Looks like this is my new home -- w..."
links.text: Looks like this is my new home -- wonder where the old one went?

links.title: Shivers: "Westward, across the canal, towers..."
links.text: Westward, across the canal, towers the Whirling-in-Rags. Door #1 on the second floor is locked, behind it lies a trashed room. One floor below, behind a counter, stands an irritable man.

links.title: Shivers: "In a small shack in the fishing vil..."
links.text: In a small shack in the fishing village, a baroque heater hums quietly, emanating a sense of comforting warmth. A washbasin lies on the table, the water inside reflecting the sombre face of the world.

links.title: Shivers: "Far away, on the corner of Perditio..."
links.text: Far away, on the corner of Perdition and Main, a nondescript building, obscured in a haze. It's vacant and lost, just like its tenant.

links.title: You: "Shake it off. [Discard thought.]"
links.text: Shake it off. [Discard thought.]
